data.title: Engine - Bad quad UV mapping (THREED-1482)

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
THREED-1482.

Build: T3D 1.1 Beta 3 Pro
Platform: Windows (not sure about Mac/Linux)
Target: quad uv mapping
Issues: It looks like the "Wild Magic" doesn't work as it should
(from Engine/source/math/util/quadTransforms.*), as it does some "magic" calculations inside BiQuadToSqr::BiQuadToSqr().
If we change (from debugger) m_kD (x or y) to something else from 0.f or 3.78e-7 (or some other crazy "diagonal dist") like 1.f â€“ it renders fine.
This easily can be seen with short roads - those rendered in a bad way:
nVidia (looks like those are just rendering what it have, while ATI skips the rendering of bad data).

data.title: Elastic ease fix
data.body:
Elastic ease used an arcsinus function where it should have used a sinus
function.

data.title: GuiObjectView camera transform and object orbit distance problem.

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: When using a GuiObjectView differing objects may appear at transforms that are severely offset to the camera, which sometimes results in an inability to see the object.  This can cause the end-user to believe that the control is not functioning.  The pull request associated with Issue #23 attempts to address this, but is not the 'proper' solution -- some objects, depending upon origin, could still appear offset from the control's viewport.  The consensus of the Steering Committee is that the proper solution would be to calculate the size of the object's bounding box and then use that calculation to automatically center the object within the field-of-view of the camera.

data.title: Edit and continue isn't working in VS2012
data.body:
In visual studio 2012 you can't do edit and continues unfortunately..

I believe it has something to do with the SAFESEH:NO option as explained [her](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/131675/1#comment-833697)

It's a pretty awesome feature so if anyone have been able to solve this please post your solution :)

I would fix it myself if I had an idea how to.

data.title: Bug: World Editor snap to grid always snaps to object centroid
data.body:
Always snapping to object centroid causes odd sized objects, e.g. 5 x 3, to not align to the grid properly. I.e. if the grid-snap is set to 1,  I expect the sides of a 5 x 3 shape to be aligned on the grid, but instead the shape is off the grid by 0.5 (5 / 2 = 2.5; 3 / 2 = 1.5).

I assumed that setting "Snap to Bounding Box" would fix the problem, but it appears to be ignored; it still snaps to the centroid whether that's set or not.

Fix: It needs to either snap to a corner of the object, or correctly use the "Snap to Bounding Box" setting.

(Note: This is with a basic imported Collada shape, no bounding box in the DAE; I assume T3D automagically creates a bounding box when importing.)

data.title: Make an easily accessable roadmap/checklist for what needs to be done to fully port Torque to Linux
data.body: For those of us who want to assist in porting to Linux, it would be very helpful to have an easily accessible checklist/roadmap of what needs to be done to port Torque to Linux. One possibility would be creating a tag "Linux Port" and put issues for each thing that needs to be done for Linux support. This would make it much easier to get involved in the porting process.

data.title: Issue 193
data.body: Fix for issue #193 for gui editor tree view not being updated on drag&drop.  Same fix was suggested by  MusicMonkey5555 as well.

data.title: Compile Engine
data.body: how I can compile this engine?

data.title: Gui Editor - Object Treeview refresh issue (THREED-3179)
data.body:
THREED-3179

When moving a object inside the treeview by drag and drop, the Gui is properly updated on the screen and in the script (if save), but the treeview is not refreshed.
As a consequence you have the feeling that the changes didn't happen. If you change the selection, the treeview is updated and you see your change.

data.title: Issue 189
data.body: Fix for Issue #189 for exception/crash on changing shapeFile in datablock editor on wheeledvehicle and for exception/crash on invoke ShapeEditor in datablock editor.  Required more QA tests to see if it didn't break anything.

data.title: Fix for Issue #190
data.body:
Without having DI8DEVTYPE_DRIVING here, many steering wheel's will show
up as "unknown" and cannot be mapped to actions. Driving and gamepad
both map to joystick for consistency, since they all can have buttons,
axes, sliders, and pov hat's.

data.title: Bug: Missing support for several Racing Wheels
data.body:
Several racing wheels (including mine "Fanatec Forza CSR") are not detected by Torque 3D and show up as "unknown" input devices even though they should show up as a "joystick" input.

The reason for this was posted on this thread:

http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/102797/1#comment-683441

This fix needs to be added.

data.title: Datablock editor crash - THREED-3163
data.body:
Issues: When a vehicle using a datablock is placed in a scene, and the datablock editor is used to replace the vehicle's shapeFile with one without a collision mesh, the engine crashes.
Steps to repeat:
Have two vehicle shapes, one with collision and one without.
Set the datablock to use the one with.
Run the game and add a vehicle with that datablock to the scene.
Open the datablock editor and change the shapeFile for that datablock to the other shape.

data.title: Updates to Project Generator necessary for library I am working with.
data.body:
I am trying to implement a library called Triton Ocean SDK as a Torque 3D module. Unfortunately it throws build errors if I don't specify the Debug lib when doing a debug build. Also I get build errors unless I specify MSVCRT in the "Ignore Specific Default Libraries".

So, what I did was add a 2nd parameter to addProjectLibInput(), the first parameter is the normal lib, the 2nd parameter is the debug lib. The debug lib defaults to null. If the debug lib is null, it uses the release lib for both (This will make it so none of the current modules break.)

For the 2nd problem, I added a new function called addProjectIgnoreDefaultLib(). This will add the lib that you specify to the "Ignore Specific Default Libraries" field in Linker->Input properties.

data.title: Formal request for pulling a fix for Issue #183 for Material Preview not showing new or browsed and selected material.
data.body: I believe the fix for #183 is in the other requests already as the case of one fix fixing multiple issues, but decided to send the request anyway just to follow the procedure.

data.title: Fix for Issue #163 for crash on selecting custom material.
data.body: This fix is only for crash on re-selecting custom material.  The problem with custom material appears broken when switch focus from the object to another or follow repro steps stated in the issue description is under investigation.

data.title: Fix for Issue #181 for ambient light color changes do not affect the preview.
Fix for Issue #82 for crash on warning print in explosion.cpp
Material Editor - material preview does not update with changes unless you change the preview shape (THREED-3193)
data.body:
THREED-3193.

In the material editor, the preview object's material does not reflect loading a new material or making changes to the current material until you change the preview shape.
Expected: Changes made to the material are reflected in the material preview immediately.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the material editor.
2. Click the browse folder button to open a different material.
3. Select a material and click select.
4. Observe the preview does not update to the new material.
5. Click the Create new material icon.
6. Observe the preview does not update to the newly created material.

data.title: New readme for v2.0
Material Editor- Ambient light color changes do not affect the preview (THREED-3194)
data.body:
Based on Jira issue THREED-3194.

In the material editor, changing the ambient light color for the preview does not change the lighting in the preview.
Expected: Ambient light color is used in the preview.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the material editor.
2. Change the ambient preview color.
3. Observe the preview lighting does not change.

data.title: GuiCanvas::getCursorPos() broken
data.body:
See original thread: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132383

The current implementation returns cursor position in screen coords, not the position on the canvas or even the Torque 3D window. As a result of this, GuiCanvas::cursorInControl() also is broken as it calls the broken method. The reason this hasn't been noticed is because these methods are unreferenced in T3D (but they're very useful!).

The fix is outlined in the above thread, but it's really just converting from screen coords to client coords.

data.title: Bug fix for loading compiled dsos
data.body: This is a bug fix for loading compiled dsos.  The bug was that if you had dso compilation on, the dso had to be out of date before it would load it so you would end up making changes to scripts and it would still load the old out of date dso instead of recompiling the script.

data.title: Bug fixes for alternative zip layout and define to toggle it on
data.body: Fixes a couple of bugs with the zip system and adds a define to use the alternative zip support where you can define your directories and files inside the zip just like you would on disk instead of the default zip support that treats the zip as an extra directory.  Just uncomment #define TORQUE_ZIP_DISK_LAYOUT at the top of platform/platformVolume.cpp or add the define to torqueConfig.h

data.title: Removal of SDL dependency for linux dedicated server
data.body: These are the changes to remove the need to have SDL installed to compile/run the linux dedicated server. One of the changes was to the project generator so you will need to regenerate make files afterwards.

data.title: Dedsdlchanges
data.body: Sorry I am a github noob and I used the wrong branch.  I posted another pull request to development but I do not see a way to delete this pull request.

data.title: Fix for Issue #174 for Turret Targeting Wrong Direction
Player turret weapon targets the wrong direction
data.body: The player's turret weapon when placed on the group targets the opposite direction from where it should.  You can test this in a multiplayer environment by placing a turret and having another player walk in front of it.

data.title: Fix for Issue #172 for Turret Crash on Dedicated Server
data.body:
The Cheetah's turret fire sound datablock happened to be named the same
as the player's turret weapon's datablock.  This caused the sound
profile's description to be NULL on the dedicated server.

data.title: Dedicated server - Crash when a turret fires at an enemy
data.body:
Originally from THREED-3198

The server crashes when any turret fires at an enemy.

Expected: no crash.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start a dedicated server.
2. Connect with 2 clients.
3. On one client, place a turret.
4. On other client, walk in front of the turret.
5. Observe server crashes as soon as the turret fires.
